result.execSummary:
The defendant Derrick D Girmscheid was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Waushara County Case No. 14CM328.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: Time served sentence with Good Time and credit for prior time served.

Court Costs reimposed and to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Contempt-60 days in the WC Jail-stayed. Purge conditions: Must post $200 prior to release then $100/month starting May 1, 2017
Contempt-60 days in the WC Jail-stayed. Purge conditions: Must post $200 prior to release then $100/month starting May 1, 2017
Financial Statment for Failure to Pay

14CM-328 and 15CM-62 - Both Cases Called @ 2:50 PM: Defendant Derrick D Girmscheid in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Counsel admit receipt of Rev Order and Warrant.  Some materials errors offered by SPD.  ADA concurs with SPD's recital.  Argument by ADA - will argue for time served sentences.   Argument by SPD:  Essentially a joint recommendation on SEHR.  Presents letter from Def's employer for Court's review.  Statement by Def prior to SEH: Yes - detailed statement offered.  The Court:  14CM-328:  30 days WCJ with TS credit of 23 days - time served SEH.  Court Costs reimposed - 60 DTP or PP.   15CM-62:  260 days WCJ with 195 days of TS credit - GT and TS SEH.   Court Costs reimposed - 60 DTP or PP.   Court declines to grant Agent's request for civil judgment on financial obligations.   Appeal Rights Given.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on January 27, 2017 at 02:45 pm.

14CM328 & 15CM62 Cases called @ 1:39 p.m. Defendant Derrick D Girmscheid in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 14CM328 - Amended complaint stated. Receipt admitted - Reading waived. The parties have reached an agreement as to all matters.   Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea:14CM328: Cts 1 & 2 - NC. 15CM62: Ct 2 - NC 14TR1436: NC.  Court accepts plea and enters JOC. 14CM328: Ct 3 - DRI. 15CM62: Cts 1, 3, 4 & 5 - DRI. 15TR239 & 240 - DRI. No statement by DE. Court orders: 14CM328: Ct 1 - Costs to included the DNA surcharge w/ 60 DTP or PP. Ct 2 - S/W - 2 years probation - Conditions: AODA and follow through, defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing or consuming any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician, Costs w/ 60 DTP or PP.15CM62: Ct 2 - S/W 2 years probation concurrent with 14CM328 - Same conditions as 14CM328. 13 days CFTS only on 15CM62. 14TR1436 - $200 fine inclusive of costs w/ 60 DTP or PP, 3 mo DL suspension. Appeal rights given.
Status conference on February 25, 2015 at 01:45 pm.
No operation of any motor vehicles without a valid driver's license.

Case called @ 1:14 p.m. Defendant Derrick D Girmscheid in court, in custody, appears via video with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading waived. Defendant will be represented by SPD. DA Blader requesting $1000 Cash Bond. Atty Szilagyi requesting signature bond or cash bond of no more than $100. Court orders $1000 Cash Bond.  NGP entered.  STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Status conference scheduled for February 25, 2015 at 01:45 pm.
